intro: Pitcairnia elvirae, commonly known as the Elvirae凤梨, is a species of bromeliad native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup, a common feature among bromeliads. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant, long-lasting flowers that range from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rock faces or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
